description.narrative: CP PCR 7 IR 7.8: By 2017, in Solomon Islands government,civil society and communities have strengthened capacity to provide children and families with improved access to child and family welfare and child justice services to prevent and respond to violence, abuse and exploitation, including in emergencies.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CP PCR 7 IR 7.8: By 2017, in Solomon Islands government,civil society and communities have strengthened capacity to provide children and families with improved access to child and family welfare and child justice services to prevent and respond to violence, abuse and exploitation, including in emergencies.

description.narrative: As the capacity of the social welfare sector to implement the Child and Family Welfare Act is being strengthened, UNICEF seized opportunities to include child protection in justice, health and emergency. Birth registration rates are increasing and a birth notification backlog will be resolved through provision of computers and training. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: Percentage of children under 5 years of age with formal birth registration.
Established inter-agency protocols and procedures for case management in selected provinces.

actual.value: 2017:No child protection-specific inter-agency procedure, SAFENET GBV procedures incorporated some child protection provisions in 2017

title.narrative: Existence of free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements

actual.value: 2017:Registration and certificate within time limit free; late registration and certificate with fee
